author: .paulharris
content: https://ethereum.github.io/eth2.0-APIs/#/Config/getDepositContract seems to be the only data structure i can find with an unquoted numeric (chain_id) - is that intentional? I can update our structures if it is, but i had defined it as int64 so that it'd come out as string like all the others...

author: .paulharris
content: eth2-comply found it (and a few others) ðŸ™‚ there's been a few things that have been good with comply, must see if theres plans to take it further to address some of the bits that are less easy heh

author: ajsutton
content: I'd recommend quoting it - I could have sworn Besu used to treat ChainID as an int and it now uses a `BigInteger` which suggests it can be bigger than a signed long which is bigger than JavaScript will handle accurately as a number (which in turns is why we wound up quoting the uint64 values to start with).

author: jgm
content: Looks like it is treated as a bigint in `go-ethereum`, so yes looks like it should be quoted (think we'll assume that it being no larger than a `uint64` is reasonable)

author: jgm
content: Added a quick PR for it at https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-APIs/pull/114
